intro: Godetia roseoalba, commonly known as the white-flowered godetia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, rose-pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Godetia roseoalba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
